lines.text: [Everyone is being sucked into the vacuum of space]
Hey, Mike, you think you can toss me my calculations? Thanks! Ah, here it is. "Breach Hull - All Die." Even had it underlined.

[after German scientist comments on Mozart at dinner]
What do you think of Mr. Mozart, Exeter?
I'm afraid I don't know the chap.
"I'm not an alien!"
My mind must have been wandering. Your composer, of course.
*Our* composer - he belongs to the world!
Yes, indeed.
"I'm not an alien."
That dinner, Exeter, was even more perfect than you promised. Now if you'll excuse me, I could do with some fresh air myself.
He's gonna get high!
Would you care to join me, Dr. Adams?
"Uh, no!"
You, Dr. Carlson?
"Your turn to walk the Cal."
Why don't you? Show him the grounds.
"I dare ya!"
We won't start cracking the whip on Meecham until tomorrow.
"Then I ram my ovipositor down your throat, and lay my eggs in your chest! But I'm *not* an alien!"
Man, the universe is really cruisin'.
Hey, look, there's Taurus the bull.
And right underneath him the constellation feces.
Hey, look, Orion's broke.
Wow, that ringing! Now he knows what the world sounds like to Pete Townshend!

[the crew catches Benkitnorf in the shower on Tom Servo's interositer]
Man, you guys scared the living daylights out of me!
It's working! Hey! Hi, is Exeter there?
Nah, him and Brack went down to Headbutt Days for Shelly. I gotta meet 'em in the beer tent in about fifteen minutes, so I gotta get going, 'kay?
No, wait! We're trapped in space! Can we use this thing to get back to Earth?
I don't know. Geez... let's see, maybe this does something...
[pushes button, zapping Servo]
Crap. That's not it. Hang on...
[gets manual]
Okay. Did you use the Intensifier Disc?
Yes.
Turn the controls 18 degrees to the left?
Did that.
Are you in Europe? Do you need an adapter?
No.
Well, look. I don't know anything about this thing. Maybe this does something...
[pushes button, zapping Servo again]
Oops. That didn't work. Okay, well I'll be sure to tell Exeter to give you a call! Bye!
Relocation? To where?
To your Earth.
A PEACEFUL relocation...
After the genocide, of course.
[upon seeing that there is no one flying the plane]
I'm your pilot, Claud Rains. Your co-pilot, Harvey the Rabbit.
[as Exeter's flying saucer catches fire]
"Service engine soon" I wonder what that's all about.
This Island Earth can be yours IF the price is right!

[as a Postman delivers a letter]
Sort this, deliver that, I'll make 'em all pay.
When in California, be sure to visit beautiful...
[the letters "Washington, D.C." appear on-screen]
Oh... Hm...
If there is any reason around here.
What with all the shenanigans and goings-on.
You know what my kids would say?
YOU'RE NOT MY REAL FATHER?
[as Cal and Joe assemble the Interositor]
Science and Industry!
See big men sticking screw drivers into things - turning them - AND ADJUSTING THEM!
Build your very own Atom Storage Box!
Bringing you state-of-the-art in soft-serve technology!
Removes lids off bottles and jars of all sizes - and it really, really works.
Into the weenie mobile, weenie man away!
Joe, I'm in one of these boxes, find me!
Hey! Who sneezed on the credits?
I'm feeling particularly evil because today's experiment is a stinky cinematic suppository called "This Island Earth." You may all bow down before me after this stinkburger.
They're forcing him to visit Branson, Missouri.
Check rate of radioactive decay.
Increase the Flash Gordon noise and put more science stuff around!
Okay, let's see here... Shatner, Shatner... no, doesn't look like he's in this one; we're safe.
I beg your pardon, Mr. Wilson, your camera will pick up nothing but black fog.
Oh, it's a Goldstar.
[after breaching the hull in an escape attempt]
Well believe me, Mike, I calculated the odds of this succeeding versus the odds I was doing something incredibly stupid... and I went ahead anyway.
Yeah, let's slip awayy under cover of afternoon in the biggetst car in the county!
Space, the final frontier, these are the voyages of Babylon 5.
He's flown into a Flemish painting.
[Dr. Forrester holds a photo of Mike Nelson]

This is my test subject, Mike Nelson - a disgustingly mild-mannered dope who's managed to survive every film I've subjected him to. But, perhaps, this movie will drive him to the breaking point and crush his soul. And then I'll unleash it on an unwitting public, and then I will rule the world!
[Laughs maniacally and spanks himself with the photo]
Yes, I'm a naughty boy! Naughty! Naughty! Naughty!... Oh, ahem.
Ah, they're going 65, so they'll be there in 3 BILLION years...
a bunch of our ship fell off, and, nobody likes me.

[gazing at the stars]
I feel so insignificant... then again, I ALWAYS feel insignificant.
Now place your hands above the rail
[hands suddenly attach to the rail]
... they're magnetized.
And if your hands were metal, that would mean something.

[as ship descends into fantastic Metaluna landscape]
Looks like Dr. Seuss designed their planet!
Oh, they're flying into a Roger Dean album cover.
They're very into "Yes" on this planet.
Hee hee!
International flights always get the gate furthest from the terminal.
Remember, we're parked in the "Denubrian Slime Devil" lot!

[Zagon bomb explodes en route to thought-transference chamber]
"Golly, those doggone Zagons are really licking us, huh! Well, let's go get your brains scrambled..."

[a MutAnt blocks their path to escape]
He appears badly hurt - stay close to me.
*Ahem* "Guten Tag! Zigaretten? Wir wollen ein Auto mieten!"

They're concentrating all their attention on Metaluna. Those flashes of light - they're meteors. Hundreds of them! The intense heat is turning Metaluna into a radioactive sun. The temperature must be thousands of degrees by now.
Cooler by the lake.
A lifeless planet. And yet...
Rents are reasonable!
Yet, still serving a useful purpose, I hope. Yes... a sun, warming the surface of some other world - giving light to those who may need it.
"Still, your whole family died. That's a bummer, huh?"
[one of the aliens is firing on the humans]
Eat my photons, small heads!
Boy, the landlady's gonna be mad.
Are you boys cooking up there?
No.
Are you making an interositor?
No!
Shall I compare thee to a summers daaaaaaaa...
See, all rights are reserved, Callahan.

[in a Clint Eastwood voice]
Yeah, but what about the rights of that little girl?
If not satisfied with this movie, please return unused portion for a full refund.
You killed the Hubble!
This is when science didn't have to have any specific purpose.

[Struggling with the controls of his jet]
I have no control...
I keep eating and eating.
I could've sworn we parked at the... Oh shit!
Well what kind of shit-hole planet is this?

[as the Universal-Internation Presents credit comes up]
Doesn't the fact that it's universal make it international?

[as Cal beats a MutAnt in the head]
Oh, I'm very vulnerable there! Oh, there go the piano lessons! I can't remember my dad!
[as entire mountain explodes]
That's what happens when you leave a potato in the microwave!
[alien spaceship catches plane in tractor beam]
I'm beginning to think they're not from around here.
No, I bet you they're English, or Canadian.
Good morning, Dr. Meecham.
Good morning, Voice.
Hope you slept well.
'Cause it's time to die.
Please be seated, Dr. Meechum. And welcome aboard.

[imitating the Plane Voice]
You're being kidnapped by The Light FM!
I won't ask you to condone what we've done...
We condone it.
[Cal and Joe are looking in an interositer catalog]
Here's something my wife could use in the house...
A man?
...an interositer incorporating an electron sorter.
She'll probably gain twenty pounds while it does all the work for her.
Cal, you bitch!
This isn't paper. It's some kind of metal.
Uh, no, that's paper, sir.
Into the converter tubes. Ruth, you take the first tube. Cal, you take the second.
What about you?
I'll take the third tube.

[as Cal]
Oh, right. Stupid question.

[after Ruth's tube opens and the mutant is attacking]
Run, Ruth, Run!
Brilliant strategy, thanks Napoleon!
You're too darned smart.
And handsome!
I may just be the dumbest man who ever lived.
No argument here.

[in a scene where the brain creature enters a room looking all around]
Uh, is the manager here? Hello?
Crow!

[stops swinging pick-axe]
Huh?
Crow, listen, you've gotta stop!
Oh, hi, Mike! I've found the perfect spot. Once I've breached through this wall we'll tunnel our way right back to Earth. URG!
[returns to swinging pick-axe]
Crow, you big dope! You can't tunnel through space.

[British accent]
Come, come, boy. We must confound Gerry at every turn!
Oh, who doesn't own an interositer these days?
Suddenly I have a refreshing mint flavor.
Puppet wranglers? There weren't any puppets in this movie.
Crow you big dope, you can't tunnel through space!
Hello, and welcome. I'm Dr. Clayton Forrester, and soon you will all bow down before me.
[Inside the environmental tubes]
Wow this must be what its like inside a bong! Whehue!
Self cleaning mutant. Leaves only the fresh scent of pine.
It's the amazing technicolor cheese wedge!
Washingtonland, the new Disney theme park.
Say, come to think about it, I don't believe you bowed down before me recently.
Sure we have - last week.
No, no, no, I think that was more of a curtsey than a bow. So why don't we all just bow down now?
I don't see any reason to make us...
[suddenly kneels, choking]

[scared]
Bowing, sir!
[Tom bows and prays to Dr. Forrester, speaking in tongues]
I've lost my toupee and girdle, and I can't leave my room!
I'm experiencing a sensation altogether new to me, and frankly I love it!
C'mon! Give Uncle Scrotor a hug!
Oh, they're flying into a Roger Dean album cover.
They're very into Yes on this planet.
[after Mike damages the Hubble]
Aaaaaaaahhhhhh!
Don't *do* that!

[as Joe comes down the stairs]
This is a job for "Weenie man!"

[as Ruth]
Oh, Carl.

[as Cal]
Er, Cal.

[as Ruth]
Oh, Cal.
Geez, Dr. Forrester!
What a dickweed!
The secret government Eggo Project!
[Watching the credits, Eastman productions comes up]
EASTMAN! He came from the east, to do battle with the amazing RANDO!
Don't leave me with the Germans!
[as Brack watches the interositer]
and now it's time for The Brack Show! Da da da-da-da DA! It's the Brack show! Staring me, I'm Brack!
[as Exeter's flying saucer crashes]
Oh, don't mind me, I'm just a weather balloon!
Just some swamp gas.
Putting the men's room in the tower, what was I thinking?
Oh, my god! My waffle! Oh the humanity!
Let go of my hand, Joe!
Sort this, deliver that, I'll make them all pay.
Hope you like cyanide!
So they worship the ever-lasting gobstopper?
I'm just gona drop you at the north pole, that okay?
Uh uh! No way! This is your dishwashing liquid! You soak in it!
G.I. Joe action set. Nerdy Joe not included.
Doesn't the fact that it's universal make it international?
Come on, you couple of single-stomach, micro-cephalic bilobes.
I'm gonna curl up in his sock drawer, and sleep for days.
[as Joe is talking, Cal ruffels through his desk]
Where's my gun?
I hope you tax payers don't mind.
We do!
Left, right, left... Left, right, left... Ouch! A door.

Wait help, auntie Em! Auntie Em! SUPRIIIIISE! Like who doesn't own an intirositor you collective heads of knuckle? Now get back in the theater you ninny-hammers! And remember, I know who you are, and I saw what you did. Now scat!
[manically laughing]
I'M THE GOD! I'M THE GOD!
Prepare yourselves for my maddest madness yet!
NORMAL VIEW! NORMAL VIIEEEEW!

[as a crewman pushes a lever]
This oughta kill them!
"Complete line of iterociter parts, incorporating greater advances than hitherto known in the field of electronics." What exactly is an iterociter?
I don't know, and I don't want to know.
Just love me!
[seeing the desolate, war-ravaged surface of Metaluna]
This must be what went on in Salvador Dali's head.
After the Armageddon.
Eat at Joes Eat At Joes, Eat at Joes
Raspberry world. For all your raspberry needs.

[Hammy]
Stand back... I command you, stand back!
ACTING!

[Bashing jauntily at the hull with a pickaxe, singing "It's a Long Way to Tipperary"]
Goodbye to Noah Beery, Hello Harold Lloyyyyd...

[as Cal, after Cal & Ruth's plane is beamed into the spaceship]
If I don't miss my guess, I think this has something to do with those white-haired fellows.

[reading from the iterociter handbook]
Iterociter incorporating planetary generator. Iterociter with voltarator. With astroscope.

[as Cal turns the book sideways]
Saaaay, Miss Interociter!

[as Cal and Ruth are captured, as Cal]
I just know they're going to probe my anus.
Cal! Pull up!
I can't. I'm too low.
I got the blues, so bad, uh huh.
[on approaching the planet Metaluna]
Eww, it's Michael Stipe's head!

[on the Mu-tant]
Nuts! It's Ted Kennedy in a Barney suit!
